page.title: 02WRITTLE, ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Church is situated just off Writtle Green. It is surrounded by the graveyard and the garden of rest. There are also a number of yew trees surrounding the church. The first part of the church dates from the twelfth century but it has been frequently added to and altered since then. In 1974 there was a fire at the church which extensively damaged the roof. A cross was made from the burnt timbers and it still stands in the church yard today. There are quite a few stained glass windows in the church but sometimes people break them with stones and they are replaced with plain glass. The church has a choir and the name of the vicar is Peter Mason.
